metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8658 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the brcmf_cfg80211_start_ap function indrivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.7.5 allows local users to cause a denial of service (systemcrash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a long SSIDInformation Element in a command to a Netlink socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-51.72
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1038.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1042.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-51.72').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.46').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
